messages.message:
@BG @hannah I’m just watching back the *Migrating customer session* that i missed the other day.
On this slide you talked about Service accounts, I’m looking to understand this a bit better:
• Are there service accounts in AI Hub?
• Do they work the same as in IB platform?
• Where do we set them up?
We don't support service accounts in AI Hub right now
The recommendation is if the customer is comfortable to create a log-in where the account is shared among multiple people to publish an application
but that won’t work with SSO?
I’ll check but I think that a hard no from my customer
That's fine - that just means they need to publish apps as is and they are tied to individual people.
are we bringing service accounts soon?
We will eventually but its not on our Q3 roadmap
Orlando - can you provide the ID of the PFR.  I would like to add other customers to the request as Service Accounts are required for API interaction from several of our customers

@Orlando: on AI Hub, We are asking for customers to use a single account to publish the apps to the Hub that they would like to distribute widely. Something like a verified account rather an any/every citizen app builder developing and/ updating an app that will be used at an enterprise level as it can follow 1 version lineage. If every citizen app builder publishes an update for the same app, they would be duplicates in the hub and it will create confusion on what is the real enterprise level solution that the process should use. You can either solve it using a single account or a process in the organization that makes one individual accountable for publishing all company level production verified apps while individuals can publish their apps for their/their  teams uses. Hope this explains it better
@BG - thank you, that’s helpful and I understand.
